p: Laboratory testing for albumin, bilirubin, and quick/international normalized ratio (INR) was performed due to standard procedures at Hannover Medical School. HCV genotype setting was performed with the INNO-LiPA by Innogenetics according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Liver cirrhosis in patients was calculated using transient elastography. The applied cutoff value for cirrhosis was >13 kPa [ 32]. In case of failed transient elastography, additional clinical and laboratory parameters (ie, albumin, bilirubin, quick, INR, sonographic proof of ascites, and stage of encephalopathy) were used to determine the stage of liver cirrhosis.
